►騒がれる　be made much of…; be lionized; receive 《much》 attention; receive a great deal of ┏sensational coverage [publicity]; be treated like a celebrity

・その歌手は若い女の子たちにきゃあきゃあ騒がれている.　The singer has young girls screaming over him (wherever he goes).

・政界で騒がれている人物　a person who ┏receives sensational attention [is lionized, is made much of, is treated like a celebrity] politically
・騒がれるのに慣れる　become accustomed to being ┏lionized [treated like a celebrity, made a fuss of, etc.].
►(地震のときは)慌てず騒がずまず火を消せ.　Do not panic or create a fuss; just put out all fires (in an earthquake).
・それはマスコミが騒いでいるだけだ.　The mass media are just making a big thing about it, that's all.
・その問題は世間が騒ぐほど深刻ではない.　That problem's not serious enough to warrant all the public uproar.
・彼は孫がプレゼントをくれたと騒いでいる.　He's all excited because his grandchild gave him a present.
・彼女はかぎをなくしたと言って騒いでいた.　She was all flustered, saying she'd lost her keys.
・引っ越しは来年だ. 今から騒ぐ必要はない.　We're not moving (house) until next year. There's no need to get worked up about it now.
・この程度のことで騒ぐな.　Don't get worked up over a small thing like this.
・何を今ごろ騒いでいるんだ.　What're you getting so worked up for at this stage?
・今更騒いでも始まらない.　It's no use making a fuss now.
・最悪の結果にも彼は少しも騒がなかった.　He didn't become the least bit agitated despite it being the worst possible result.
・彼は今でもビートルズ, ビートルズと騒いでいる.　Even now he's just ┏crazy [《口》 gaga] about the Beatles.

1 〔別れのあいさつ〕 good-by(e); farewell; adieu; 《口》 so long; bye; ᐦcheerio(h); ᐦta-ta; 《主に小児》 bye-bye; (昼の) ᐦgood day; (夜の) good night.
►さよならをする[言う]　say good-by(e) to sb; bid sb farewell

・皆さんさようなら　Good-by(e), everybody!
・(では)さようなら, また明日.　Good-by(e) till tomorrow! ｜ Good-by(e)! See you tomorrow!
・私は心の中でふるさとにさようならと言った.　In my heart I said good-by(e) to my hometown.
2 〔別れること・それで終わりにすること〕 putting an end 《to…》; calling a halt 《to…》; saying good-by(e) 《to…》.

・17 年連れ添った女房とさよならしちゃった.　I said good-by(e) to my wife after seventeen years with her.

・(組織などを)成立させる　form; organize
・法案が成立した.　The bill has ┏become law [passed, been passed].
・本年度の予算は昨日成立した.　The budget for the current fiscal year was given the Diet's final approval yesterday.
・その予算は成立しなかった.　The budget failed to secure the Diet's approval.
・彼の動議は 130 票対 95 票をもって成立した.　His motion was carried by 130 votes to 95.
・小泉政権が成立した.　The Koizumi administration has ┏been formed [come into power].
・彼のアリバイが成立した.　His alibi has been established.
・源氏物語は 1000 年ごろに成立した.　The Tales of Genji ┏appeared [was written, came into existence] about the year 1,000 AD.
・そのことから日本人の祖先ははるか南方から来たという説が成立する.　This is the basis for the theory that the ancestors of the Japanese arrived from far to the south.
・その合併により業界第 3 位の会社が成立した.　This merger created the third biggest company in the industry.
・児童文学では太陽も壁もしゃべる. 大人の文学では成立しえないようなことも何でも許される世界だ.　In children's books the sun speaks, walls speak. It is a world not permitted to exist in books for grown-ups.
・…についても同様の関係が成立する.　【数】 A similar relation ┏applies [holds] for….
・この場合にも運動量保存は成立する.　【数・物】 The conservation of momentum holds in this case, too.
►彼は鎌倉幕府の成立に貢献した.　He contributed to ┏the establishment of [setting up] the Kamakura Shogunate.
►いろは歌成立のなぞに迫る　look into the riddle of the creation of iroha verses; try to work out when and how iroha verses came into existence.
►法案の成立を阻止する　prevent a bill ┏being passed [becoming law]; interfere with the passing of a bill.
2 〔協定などがまとまること〕 conclusion.
〜する be concluded.
►和解が成立した.　Peace has come into effect 《between A and B》.
・条約[契約] が成立した.　The ┏treaty [contract] has been concluded.
・両国の間に通商条約が成立した.　A treaty of commerce was ┏concluded [effected] between the two nations.
・その縁談は成立しなかった.　The proposed match was broken off.
・二人の間に婚約が成立した.　A marriage has been arranged between the two of them.
・両者の間に妥協が成立した.　A compromise has been ┏effected [reached] between the two.

►責任を負う[持つ, 取る]　bear [assume, take, shoulder] the responsibility 《for [of]…》; hold oneself ┏responsible [accountable] 《for…》; answer 《for…》; be ┏liable [answerable] 《for…》; take the blame 《for…》

・責任を感じて辞職する　resign ┏from a sense of one's responsibility [because one feels responsible] 《for…》
・責任を取って辞職する　take ┏(the) responsibility [the blame] and resign
・一切の責任を取らない　disclaim all the responsibility 《for…》
・責任を免除する　absolve sb from blame
・責任を問う　call sb to account; take [call] sb to task 《for…》
・責任を追及する　blame sb 《for…》; try to pin the blame on 《sb》; try to establish sb's responsibility 《for》; attribute ┏(the) responsibility [the blame] to 《sb's incompetence》
・責任をうやむやにする　leave it unclear ┏who is responsible [where the fault lies]; fail to clarify ┏the responsibility [who is to blame]
・責任を回避する　avoid [abdicate, evade, shirk] one's responsibility 《for…》; avoid the onus 《of doing sth》; get out of taking the blame
・彼は責任を逃れようとうそをついた.　He lied in order to evade responsibility. ｜ He tried to ┏get out of being blamed [duck the blame] by lying.

しぼる【絞る・搾る】 [ローマ字](shiboru)
1 【絞る】 〔水気を取るためにねじる〕 wring; squeeze.
►タオルを絞る　wring out a towel; wring water ┏from [out of] a towel; give a towel a wring; squeeze (out) water from a towel
・絞って乾かす　squeeze 《a towel》 dry; wring out 《a towel》 (and dry 《it》)
・固く絞った布でふく　wipe sth with a well-wrung cloth
・ゆでたホウレンソウを軽く絞る　lightly squeeze the moisture out of boiled spinach
・ぎゅっと絞る　wring [squeeze] sth tightly
・観客の涙を絞る　wring tears out of the audience; make the audience cry; move the audience to tears
・(涙に濡れた)袖を絞る　shed tears.
►彼の服は絞るばかりに濡れていた.　His clothes were ┏wringing [dripping] wet.
・その映画を見てハンカチを絞らない人はいなかった.　No one who saw the film could refrain from tears. ｜ When the movie was shown there was not a dry eye in the house.
2 【搾る】 〔圧搾して液をとる〕 squeeze; press; extract.
►リンゴの汁を搾る　press the juice ┏from [out of] an apple
・山梨産のブドウを搾って造るワイン　a wine ┏obtained [pressed] from Yamanashi grapes
・グレープフルーツの汁を搾ってコップに入れる　squeeze the juice of a grapefruit into a glass; squeeze grapefruit juice into a glass
・(牛の)乳を搾る　milk a cow
・(母親が自分の)母乳を搾って取っておく　squeeze out some breast milk and put it aside; set aside some (of one's) breast milk
・油を搾る　extract oil.
►この牛乳は搾りたてです.　This milk ┏is [has come] straight [fresh] from the cow.
・レモンをちょっと搾った水割りブランデーを作ってくれ.　Brandy and water, please, with a little ┏lemon squeezed [squeeze of lemon] in it.
3 【絞る】 〔無理に出す〕 press out; squeeze.
►知恵を絞る　strain one's wits; rack [cudgel] one's brains
・脳みそを絞る　rack [cudgel, beat, puzzle] one's brains 《about [over]…, to do》; struggle hard to think out 《a plan》; think hard
・声を絞る　strain [force] one's voice.
4 【搾る】 〔搾取する〕 extort; squeeze; exploit; 《口》 soak 《the rich》; sweat 《one's employees》.
►税を搾る　extort [squeeze, screw] taxes out of sb; force sb to pay taxes; 《口》 bleed the taxpayer
・膏血を搾る　⇒こうけつ２.
5 【搾る】 〔厳しく叱る〕 scold; take [call, bring] sb to task; 《口》 lay into sb; *《口》 bawl [chew] out; 《文》 reprimand; 〔厳しく鍛える〕 train sb ruthlessly.
►練習で部員を搾る　toughen up members through training; give the members a ┏tough [punishing] training
・先生に搾られる　be ┏fiercely scolded [given a fierce scolding] by a teacher; be ┏called to task [hauled over the coals] by a teacher
・みっちり搾られる　〔叱られる〕 be thoroughly scolded; get a thorough scolding; 〔鍛えられる〕 be [get] thoroughly trained; get (a) tough training
・無断外泊して父にこってり搾られた.　Dad really laid into me [I got a fierce scolding from my father] for spending the night out without permission.
6 〔せばめる〕 narrow (down); close tight; press; 【機】 〔エンジンなどを減速させる〕 throttle.
►袋の口をしぼる　tighten the string of a bag
・幕をしぼる　gather (up) a curtain
・レンズを絞る　stop down the lens; reduce the aperture
・(ステレオなどの)音量をしぼる　reduce [lower, turn down] the volume
・ウエストを絞ったデザインの服　a dress (designed) with ┏a narrow waist [the waist drawn in]
・体を絞る　reduce one's [lose] weight
・ウエートトレーニングで体重を 60 キロに絞った.　With weight training I ┏brought my weight down [got myself down] to sixty kilograms.
・的を絞る　narrow down one's objectives
・(捜査で)容疑者を絞る　narrow down the suspects
・対象を若者に絞る　limit one's target to [focus on] young people
・問題点を一つに絞る　concentrate [focus] on one problem
・交渉は一点に絞られてきた.　The negotiations have ┏been narrowed down to a single issue [come to focus on just one point].
・議論を要点だけに絞る　narrow an argument down to the main points.
►受験者を書類審査でまず 50 人に絞った.　We started by narrowing down the candidates to fifty by looking at their documents. ｜ At first we weeded out the weaker candidates by reference to their CVs and brought down the number of candidates to fifty.
・機能を絞ることによって価格を抑えたパソコンが発売された.　Less expensive computers, with reduced and targeted functions, went on sale.
7 【絞る】 〔弓を強くひく〕 bend; draw.
►弓を絞る　bend a bow (as far as it will go).
8 【絞る】 【相撲】 〔締めつける〕 hold down; constrict; immobilize.
►差し手を絞る　immobilize one's opponent's arm by squeezing it under one's forearm.

・山の植物を荒らす者は山に登る資格はない.　People who destroy mountain plants aren't qualified to go mountain climbing.

しまつ【始末】 [ローマ字](shimatsu)
1 〔処理〕 management; disposal; control; (a) settlement; (a) solution.
〜する 〔処理する〕 manage; deal with…; dispose of…; take care of…; look after…; attend to…; sort out; cope with…; 〔片づける〕 put in order; put [stow] away.
►残り物を始末する　clear away [deal with] the ┏remains [leftovers]
・ネズミやゴキブリを捕まえて始末する　catch rats or cockroaches and ┏deal with [get rid of, kill] them.
►ごみの始末　dealing with [disposal of] garbage [rubbish, waste]; garbage management
・けんかの始末　dealing with a quarrel; settling a conflict.
►常日ごろ始末が悪いと, いざ必要な時, 物がどこにあるかわからず苦労する.　If you don't ┏keep things tidy [put things away properly] every day, you can't find them when ┏you suddenly need them [there's an emergency]. [⇒始末が悪い]
►始末に困るほど金を持ってみたいものだ.　It would be nice to have so much money that you ┏didn't know what to do [couldn't cope] with it. ｜ I wish I had the problem of wondering what to do with all my money.
・死体の始末に困る　do not know [be at a loss] what to do with a corpse; face the difficulty of ┏dealing with [getting rid of] a body
・産業廃棄物の始末に困って不法投棄をする　dispose of industrial waste illegally because one can't cope with it any other way.
►犬のふんの始末をする　clear up after one's dog; 《卑》 clear up dog shit
・火の始末をする　put out the fire
・自分で自分の始末をつける　decide what to do with oneself; take care of oneself oneself (▶最初の oneself が take care of の目的語で, あとの oneself が強意の代名詞); manage one's own ┏concerns [affairs]; 〔自殺する〕 kill oneself; commit suicide
・部下がしでかした失敗の始末をつける　sort out [deal with] a subordinate's blunder.
►彼は年を取って自分の始末もできなくなった.　He's got too old to ┏look after himself [cope by himself].
・あとの始末は私がする.　Leave the rest to me. ｜ I'll put matters right. ｜ I'll take responsibility for sorting things out.
・〔相手の不祥事に対し〕 この始末はどうつけるつもりだ.　What ┏are you going to [do you propose to, do you plan to] do about it? ｜ You're not going to leave things like this, I hope.
2 〔事の次第・事情〕 circumstances; the facts of the matter; the state of things; (委細) the particulars; 〔(望ましくない)結果〕 the outcome.
►こんな始末になってしまって大変申し訳ありません.　I am very sorry things have ┏worked [turned] out this way.
►なんだこの始末は.　What's all this? ｜ What's going on? ｜ What a mess!
・彼は残った貯金も食いつぶし今では借金までする始末だ.　He used up all his savings and now he has been reduced to borrowing.
・その迷子の女の子は名前を聞いても泣きだす始末で, 僕たちはただ途方に暮れた.　We asked the lost girl her name but that just made her burst into tears, so we had no idea what to do.
3 〔倹約〕 thrift; frugality; economy.
〜する save; economize; exercise economy.
►始末がよい[悪い]　be ┏thrifty [unthrifty]
・家の中の始末がいいと子供の教育にもいい.　If you are thrifty in the house it is good training for the children, too.
始末が悪い　〔対処のしようがない, たちが悪い〕 difficult [hard] to deal with; hard to ┏handle [manage]; unmanageable; intractable; incorrigible; refractory; *《口》 rambunctious.
►彼は何かというとすぐ切れるし, 切れると止まらないし, どうにも始末が悪い.　He flies into a rage at the slightest word and just won't calm down again. He's completely ┏out of control [unmanageable, impossible to deal with].
・埋めても腐らず, 燃やすとダイオキシンが出るプラスチックゴミは始末が悪い.　Plastics are ┏a real problem [very difficult to deal with]. They won't decompose if you bury them and they produce dioxin if you burn them.
始末に負えない　〔手に負えない〕 difficult [hard] to deal with; hard to ┏manage [deal with]; unmanageable; intractable; incorrigible; refractory; *《口》 rambunctious.
►始末に負えない子供　an ┏incorrigible [intractable] child; a wild child
・始末に負えない荒馬　an ┏unruly [unmanageable] horse
・始末に負えなくなる　get [go] out of control; be ┏beyond [out of] control; get out of hand; become unmanageable
・放射性廃棄物はその処理を誤ると始末に負えない.　Any mishandling of radioactive waste can ┏lead to it going out of control [have disastrous and unforeseeable consequences].
・1 年間の留守中につる性の草が茂って庭は始末に負えなくなっていた.　In the year I'd been away, vines and creepers had taken over, and the garden was completely out of control.
始末をつける　settle 《a problem》; put an end to…; wind up 《an undertaking》; liquidate; get rid of…; do away with….
►事の始末をつける　settle a matter; put an end to a matter
・どうにか始末をつける　manage to get things straight
・死体の始末をつける　deal with a corpse; get rid of a body
・出発する前にこのことはすっかり始末をつけておかねばならない.　I've got to ┏see this all settled [deal with all this] before I leave.
・〔へまをした相手に〕 この始末はちゃんとつけてくれるんだろうな.　I'll expect you to do something about this. ｜ This isn't the end of the matter, of course. ｜ 〔金銭的に〕 You'll reimburse me, of course, won't you?

しまう【仕舞う・了う】 [ローマ字](shimau)
1 【仕舞う】 〔終わりにする〕 finish; get through; conclude; end; put ┏an end [a period] 《to…》; bring sth to a close.
►(その日の)仕事をしまう　finish [get through, be done with] one's work for the day; have done for the day; leave off (one's) work.
2 【仕舞う】 〔閉じる〕 close; shut up; shut down; wind up.
►店をしまう　〔その日の営業を〕 close the store; close shop; close [shut] the doors; put up the shutters; 〔廃業する〕 close [go out of] business; wind [give] up business; close [break up] one's business.
3 【仕舞う】 〔かたづける〕 put sth away; stow away; tuck away 《in a box》; hide away 《in a drawer》; stash (away) 《drugs》; (元の所に) put back; 《文》 replace; 〔しまっておく〕 keep; save; store; put [lay] by.
►茶道具をしまう　put away the ┏tea things [tea ceremony equipment]
・着物をしまう　put kimono away
・ひな人形をしまう　put away [take down] the hina dolls
・読み終えた本を本棚にしまう　put a book back on the bookshelf after finishing it; replace a book (in the bookshelf) when one has finished it
・安全な場所にしまう　put sth (away) in a safe place
・商品を倉庫にしまっておく　put the goods (away) in a warehouse; store [keep] the goods in a warehouse
・大切にしまっておく　put sth away [keep sth] carefully; store sth carefully; lock sth away carefully
・(金などを使わずに)しまっておく　hoard up 《money》
・思い出を胸にしまう　keep a memory locked in one's breast; never forget 《happy times》; cherish a memory
・秘密を胸の中にしまっておく　lock up a secret in one's breast; keep 《what happened, the truth》 to oneself (for ever); keep sth a secret (to the grave).
►手紙は机の引き出しにしまいました.　I put the letter in a drawer in my desk.
・これはどこにしまうの?　Where do you ┏put [keep] this? ｜ Where does this go?
・このカシミアのコート, どうやってしまうの?　What do you do about putting this cashmere coat away? ｜ How do you ┏store [deal with storing] this cashmere coat?
・それをどこにしまったか忘れてしまった.　I've forgotten where I ┏put it (away) [stored it].
・お宅はしまう所がたくさんあっていいわね.　It's nice that there's so much storage space in your house. ｜ It's great having [You're lucky to have] so many places to store things.
・押し入れにしまいっぱなしだったから, この布団はちょっとかび臭い.　This futon has been in the closet [I've left this futon in the cupboard] for a long time, so it smells rather musty.
4 【了う】 〔(動詞の連用形に「て」がついた形に接続して)完了する〕
►その本は一晩で読んでしまった.　I read the book (through) in one night. ｜ I got through the whole book in a single night.
・明日の分まで仕事をやってしまった.　I've done the work for tomorrow, too.
・やってしまったことはしかたがないとあきらめるしかないよ.　What's done can't be undone [It's no use crying over spilt milk, There's nothing we can do about what we've already done]. We'll just have to accept it.
・知らぬ間にすっかり暗くなってしまった.　Before we noticed, it had grown completely dark. ｜ 《文》 Darkness fell on us unawares.
・彼の変な格好に思わず笑ってしまった.　I couldn't help laughing at his strange appearance. ｜ He looked so strange that I went and laughed aloud.

しる２【知る】 [ローマ字](shiru)
1 〔認識する・知識や情報などを持つ〕 know; be aware of…; learn; find out; become acquainted with….
►知る権利　the right to know; the right to free access to information
・己を知る　know oneself
・知るべきことをすべて知る　know all there is to know 《about…》
・それが確かだと知る　know that that is certain
・よく知っている　know well; be well aware 《of…》; have a good knowledge 《of…》; be well informed 《about…》; be (well) versed 《in…》
・この辺はよく知っている.　I am ┏well acquainted [familiar] with this neighborhood. ｜ I know every inch of this neighborhood.
・彼は昔の飛行機については何でもよく知っている.　He has a good knowledge of anything to do with early airplanes.
・…のことなら一から十[何から何]まで知っている　know it like the back of one's hand when it comes to…
・名[顔]を知っている　know sb by ┏name [sight]
・よく知った顔　an old familiar face
・私の知っているところでは　as [so] far as I know; to (the best of) my knowledge
・知られる　⇒しられる
・知れる　⇒しれる
・…の知るところとなる　be found out by…; come to sb's knowledge
・ついにそのことが担任の先生の知るところとなった.　In the end the matter became known to the class teacher.
・知る者と知らざる者　the knows and know-nots.
・知らざるを知らずとせよ, これ知るなり.　When you do not know something, admit it―this shows that you know.
►知る人ぞ知る.　Those who know it, know it very well (though it isn't known to many people). ｜ To ┏those [people] in the know, it's very well known.
・この近くでよいお医者さんを知りませんか.　Do you know of any good doctor near here?
・昨日の夜地震があったの知ってた?　Did you feel the earthquake last night?
・彼が賄賂(わいろ)をもらっていたことは私がちゃんと知っている.　I was quite aware of the fact that he had been bribed.
・自国の歴史を正しく知ることが必要だ.　It's necessary to have a correct knowledge of the history of one's country.
・新聞で君の受賞を知った.　I found out about your being awarded a prize from (reading about it in) the (news)paper.
・母の苦労を知っているから同じ道は歩みたくない.　I know how hard my mother's life has been, and I don't want to walk down the same path.
・そんなことぐらいだれでも[だれだって]知ってるよ.　Everybody knows ┏that [something as obvious as that]. ▶that に強勢を置く.
・あの人の名前はだれでも知っている.　That person's name is a household word.
・フランス語も多少知っている.　She knows a bit of French, too.
・ドイツ語はほんの少ししか知りません.　My German is very limited.
・私が知ってるわけないじゃない.　How should I know? ｜ I'm blest if I know.
・「ねえ, 三ノ輪ってとこ知ってる?」「うん, 聞いたことあるね」　"Say, have you heard of Minowa?"―"Sure, I've heard of it."
・知る者は言わず, 言う者は知らず.　The wise do not talk, and the talkative are not wise. ｜ Still waters run deep. 【諺】
・その事件の事情を知る人物に会えた.　I was able to meet the person who knows the circumstances of the incident.
・知ったふうな口をきくな!　Sure, as if you knew that.
・知った顔をして　knowingly; with a knowing look
・「私の財布どこにあるか知ってる?」「知らないね」　"Do you know where my purse is?"―"Search me."
2 〔理解する〕 understand; appreciate; know; 〔認める・悟る〕 recognize; realize; be ┏awake [alive] to….
►健康のありがたみを知る　appreciate the blessing of health
・問題の重要性を知る　realize the importance of a problem
・自分の間違いを知る　realize that one has made an error
・一を聞いて十を知る　be quick ┏to understand [《口》 on the uptake].
►彼女はクラシック音楽のことは何も知らない.　She has no ┏appreciation [understanding] of classical music.
・君は彼がどんな人間か知らないからそんなことが言えるんだ.　You can say that because you don't realize what sort of a person he is.
・彼の顔を見て一部始終を知った.　I understood the whole picture when I saw his face.
3 〔知り合いである〕 be acquainted 《with…》; know; 〔知り合いになる〕 become acquainted 《with…》; make sb's acquaintance; form an acquaintance 《with…》.
►知った顔に出会う　come across a familiar face
・知らない顔　a strange [an unfamiliar] face; a stranger
・私の知っている男の子　a boy of my acquaintance
・私のよく知っている人　someone ┏I know well [I'm well acquainted with]
・ああ, 彼のことなら昔からよく知っているよ.　Oh yes, I've known him for years.
►どうしてあの人を知るようになったのですか.　How did you come to know him?
・たいていは私の知らない人だった.　Most of them were strangers to me.
4 〔気づく〕 find; see; notice; perceive; realize; sense; become [be] conscious [cognizant] of…; be ┏alive [awake] to…; 〔発見する〕 find out; detect.
►危険を知る　sense danger
・自分の欠点を知る　become conscious of one's (own) shortcomings
・薄々知っている　have an inkling 《of…》.
►そこで初めて道を間違えたことを知った.　It was there that I first realized that I had taken the wrong road.
・そんなたくらみがあろうとはつゆ知らなかった.　I was completely unaware of such a plot.
・その事実を家に帰って初めて知った.　I didn't learn the fact until I got home.
・子を持って初めて親の恩を知った.　I only realized how much I owed my parents when I had a child of my own.
・知らぬは亭主ばかりなり.　The husband is always the last to ┏find out [know].
・知らぬが仏.　Where ignorance is bliss, 'tis folly to be wise. 【諺】 ｜ Ignorance is bliss. ｜ What you don't know ┏won't [can't] hurt you.
5 〔推測する〕 infer; guess; gather 《from sb's talk》.
►彼の口ぶりから計画がうまく行っていないことを知った.　From his remark I gathered that the plan was not working well.
・他は推(お)して知るべし.　The rest may easily be ┏inferred [imagined].
6 〔感じる〕 feel; be conscious of…; be sensible ┏of [to]…; be alive to….
►恥を知る　feel shame; have a sense of honor
・恥を知れ.　You ought to be ashamed of yourself. ｜ Shame on you!
・彼は恥を知らない.　He is shameless. ｜ He is ┏dead [lost] to shame.
►彼女は哀れみということをまったく知らない女だ.　She's a woman who feels no pity whatsoever. ｜ Pity is a word that has no place in her vocabulary.
・交通事故の恐ろしさをまざまざと知った.　The ┏horrors [horrible reality] of traffic accidents were brought home to me.
7 〔覚えている〕 remember; 〔なじみのある〕 be familiar 《with…》.
►知っている道　a familiar road; a road one ┏remembers [recognizes]
・よく知っている飲食店　a restaurant I know well (because I go there often)
・知らない土地へ行く　go to a strange land.
8 〔経験して覚える〕
►酒の味を知る　know the taste of sake
・男[女]を知る　know [have knowledge of] a ┏man [woman].
9 〔関わる〕 be concerned with…; have to do with….
►それは僕の知ったことじゃない.　I have nothing to do with the matter. ｜ It's no concern of mine. ｜ That's not my business. ｜ 《俗》 To hell with that.
・そんなことおまえの知ったこっちゃない.　It's none of your business.
・会社がどうなろうと俺の知ったことか.　I don't give a damn what happens to the company.
・「そんなところに(車を)止めたら後の人が困るだろ」「知るもんか」　"If you park there the person parked behind you won't be able to get out."―"Who cares?"
・そんなに食べてお腹が痛くなっても知りませんからね.　If you get a tummy ache from eating so much, you won't get any sympathy from me.
・知らないからな.　I won't be responsible for this.
・「しまった, 彼女との約束 5 時だったの忘れてた」「えー, ぼくは知らないからねー. 彼女今ごろかんかんだぜ」　"Darn! I forgot I promised to meet her at 5."―"What!? Leave [Keep] me out of this. She must be madder than hell right now."
・知るか!　〔しつこく質問されて〕 How should I know? ▶I に強勢を置く. ｜ 〔何かを頼まれて〕 It's got nothing to do with me.
知らない　do not know; be ignorant of….
►まったく知らない　know nothing at all [do not know a thing] 《about…》; have no idea whatsoever 《of…, how…》; do not know the first thing 《about…》
・その件に関しては一切知らない.　I don't know a thing about the incident.
・何も知らないで　unknowing(ly)
・高校に入るまで両親の苦労などろくに知らないで過ごしていた.　Till I went to high school I had little idea of how much my parents were struggling.
・知らないでいる　remain ┏ignorant [in ignorance] 《of…》; be unaware of…
・知らないでいるほうが幸せということもある.　Sometimes you'll be happier if you remain ignorant. ｜ Sometimes you're better off not knowing.
・そうとも知らないで　not knowing that
・知らないふり[顔]をする　⇒しらんかお
・知らないと言う　deny any knowledge 《of…》
・知らないと言い張る　stoutly maintain one's ignorance (though one is not ignorant)
・知らないものは知らないとする　make no secret of one's ignorance
・いくら聞かれても知らないものは知らない.　It doesn't matter how ┏much [many times] you ask, if I don't know, I don't know.
・そのことはだれも知らない.　Nobody knows (about) that.
・この辺はまったく知らない.　I don't know this area at all.
・はっきりとは知らない.　I don't know for certain.
・知らないふりをしてもむだだ.　It's no use feigning ignorance.
・この事実, まさか知らなかったとは言わせない.　There's no way I'll [I'm not going to] let you say you didn't know about this.
・彼には人の知らない悲しみがあった.　He nursed a secret sorrow.
・君のような立場の人が法律を知らないでは通らない.　Somebody in your position can't be excused by pleading ignorance of the law.
・それ以上は知らない.　I know nothing (about it) beyond that. ｜ My knowledge (of it) ends there.
・あいつはそのことはてんで[まるっきり]知らないよ.　He doesn't know the first thing about it.
・彼は本当に何も知らないと言っている.　He says he doesn't have a thing to do with it.
・彼はまるでものを知らない.　He doesn't know the most ordinary things. ｜ He has no common sense at all.
知らない間に[知らぬ間に, 知らないうちに]　before one ┏knows about sth [is aware of sth]; without one's knowledge; 《take place》 insidiously.
►知らない間にその話は決まっていた.　Before I knew about it the thing was decided.
・君のお父さんが知らない間にだれかがそれをこっそり持っていったのだろう.　Somebody apparently walked off with it without your father knowing (about) it.
・知らないうちに寝てしまった.　I fell asleep without realizing it.
知りたがる　be curious to know; be ┏curious [inquisitive] 《about…》.
►彼女は何でも知りたがる.　She's ┏curious [inquisitive] about everything.
知る[知っている]限り(では)　as far as one knows.
►私の知っている限りでは　as [so] far as I know; to (the best of) my knowledge
・僕の知っている限りではその計画は一時保留になったはずだ.　As far as I know [To the best of my knowledge], that plan was put on hold.
・「あのあたりにインド料理の店はあったっけ」「私の知る限りでは一軒もなかったと思うな」　"Was there an Indian restaurant in that neighborhood?"―"Not that I know of―not a one."
(そうと[それと])知らずに　without knowing it.

しるし１【印・標・徴・験】 [ローマ字](shirushi)

・ハトは平和のしるしである.　The dove is ┏a symbol [symbolic] of peace.
3 〔証し〕 a proof 《of…》; evidence 《of [for]…》; a testimony 《to…》.
►…のしるしとして　in proof of…; as a proof of…

4 〔徽章〕 a badge; a mark.

6 〔気持ちを示すもの〕 a token; a mark; a sign; a manifestation.

►これは死が近づいているしるしかもしれない.　This may be a sign of the approach of death.

しずか【静か】 [ローマ字](shizuka)
〜な 〔音の立たない〕 quiet 《place》; silent 《audience》; still 《water》; 〔穏やかな〕 calm; placid; tranquil; serene; peaceful; 〔激しくない〕 soft 《rain》; gentle 《voice》; 〔しとやかな〕 graceful 《deportment》; subdued 《manners》; 〔ゆっくりした〕 slow 《walk》; 〔動かない〕 still 《water》; 〔ひっそりした〕 deserted 《street》.
►静かな雨　a ┏gentle [soft] rain
・静かな海　a ┏calm [placid] sea
・静かな物腰　gentle manners; graceful address
・静かな音楽　quiet music
・静かな生活　a ┏quiet [peaceful, tranquil, serene] life
・実に静かである　be very peaceful; be as still as still can be; be so quiet you could hear a pin drop
・校舎全体が死んだように静かだった.　The whole school building was as silent as the grave.
►その湖畔の宿では都会では味わえない静かな気分を味わった.　At the lakeside inn we enjoyed a peaceful atmosphere we can never find in the city.
・ロシアでは相撲が静かな人気を呼んでいるそうだ.　Sumo is said to be enjoying quiet popularity in Russia.
・純国産の紅茶が静かなブームになっている.　Purely domestically produced black tea is enjoying a quiet boom.
静かさ　stillness; calmness.
►湖の波の静かさは海岸育ちの彼には信じられないほどであった.　Having grown up near the ocean, he found the waters of the lake to be surprisingly placid.
静かに　still; calmly; quietly; peacefully; softly; gently; slowly.
►静かに寝ている　〔眠って〕 be sleeping ┏quietly [in peace]; 〔横になって〕 by lying quietly 《in bed》
・静かに暮らす　live in quiet; lead a quiet life
・静かに話す　speak ┏quietly [softly, in a quiet voice, in gentle tones]
・静かに考える　serenely think about sth
・静かに夜が明けた.　The day dawned serenely.
・静かに夜が更けていく.　The night wears on ┏silently [quietly].
・もっと静かに弾いて[話して]ください.　Play [Speak] softer [more quietly], please.
・静かに.　Hush! ｜ Keep still! ｜ Quiet! ｜ Pipe down! ｜ 〔議場で〕 Order! order!
・まあお静かに.　〔興奮している人をなだめて〕 Now just calm down. ｜ Calm yourself, please.
・静かに, だれか来た.　Shh! Someone's coming.
静かにする　be ┏quiet [still, silent].
►静かにしている　keep ┏quiet [still]; be silent
・静かにさせる　have sb become ┏quiet [still, silent]
・静かにしないと命がないぞ.　Keep quiet or you're ┏dead [a goner].
静かになる　＝しずまる 1.
►場内は水を打ったように静かになった.　Hushed [Dead] silence fell over the hall.
・秋になって避暑の客が帰り, 高原は静かになった.　When autumn came the people who had come to escape the summer heat returned and the highlands became quiet.
・いくら叱っても犬が静かにならない.　The dog won't stop barking no matter how much I yell at it.

しずまる【静まる・鎮まる】 [ローマ字](shizumaru)
1 【静まる】 〔音がなくなる〕 become ┏quiet [still, silent, hushed]; calm [quiet] down; grow still.
►会場のざわめきが静まった.　The rustling and stirring in the hall quieted down.
・競技場はしんと静まった.　A hush fell over the stadium.
2 【鎮まる】 〔穏やかになる〕 subside; become tranquil; quiet [die] down; abate; (落ち着く) calm down; (凪(な)ぐ) calm down; die down.
►その知らせを聞いて心が鎮まった.　When I heard the news I ┏felt at peace [calmed down].
・人々の興奮はなかなか鎮まらなかった.　It was a long time before people's excitement ┏died down [abated].
・彼女の気持ち[気]が鎮まるまで待とう.　Let's wait until she calms down.
・風が鎮まった.　The wind has ┏died down [abated].
3 【鎮まる】 〔勢いがなくなる〕 calm [die] down; abate; subside; (鎮圧される) be suppressed; be repressed; be quelled; be put down; 〔痛みや咳(せき)が止まる〕 go ┏down [away]; stop; abate; 〔鎮座する〕 rest 《in…》; abide 《in…》.
►この社(やしろ)に鎮まる幾多の英霊　the numerous souls of fallen soldiers resting in this shrine.
►火勢が鎮まり始めた.　The fire has begun to ┏die down [abate, subside].
・騒ぎはようやく鎮まった.　The ┏disturbance [riot] was put down at last.
・嵐が鎮まった.　The storm has abated.
・咳[歯の痛み]がやっと鎮まった.　The ┏coughing has finally abated [toothache has finally gone away].

・彼女は失敗してすっかり沈み込んでいた.　She was completely depressed about failing.

しずむ【沈む】 [ローマ字](shizumu)
1 〔下降する〕 go down; fall down; (水面などから) sink; dip; submerge; 〔底に着く〕 go to the bottom.
►海底に沈む　sink [go] to the bottom (of the sea)
・どんどん沈む　sink ┏fast [rapidly]
・沈まないようにしておく　keep sth afloat
・沈んだ船　a sunken ship; a submerged boat.
►彼の体は波にのまれて沈んでいった.　He was swallowed by the waves and went under.
・機体ががくんと沈んだ.　The plane dropped straight down.
・ボートが沈みそうだ.　It looks ┏as if [《口》 like] the boat's going to sink.
・船は沈みかけている.　The ship's sinking.
・乗組員たちは船もろとも海底へ沈んでいった.　The crew went down to the bottom of the sea together with the ship.
・その巨大戦艦は南シナ海に今も沈んだままだ.　That giant battleship is still lying on the bottom of the South China Sea.
・投げたコインはゆっくり水底に沈んだ.　The tossed coin slowly sank to the bottom.
・あまりの疲労で体が沈むような気がする.　My body feels leaden from being overfatigued.
・転覆したカヌーは激流を浮きつ沈みつ流されていった.　The overturned canoe was swept down the turbulent stream, bobbing to the surface and sinking out of sight in turns.
・彼の球は打者の手前でぐんと沈んだ.　His pitch dropped suddenly just before it reached the batter.
・挑戦者の野望もマット上に沈んだ.　The challenger's ambition sank to the mat with him.
2 〔めり込む〕 sink; give way; cave in; subside; sag.
►その家は長年の間に土台が幾分沈んでしまった.　The house's foundation has sank somewhat over the years.
・歩くたびに床のこの部分が沈む.　This part of the floor sags every time we walk on it.
3 〔(水位の上昇で)水没する〕 become submerged under water; 〔見えなくなる〕 sink out of sight; (太陽などが) set; go down.
►沈みかけた太陽　the ┏setting [declining] sun.
►村はダムの底に沈んだ.　The village disappeared under the dammed-up waters.
・彼女の後ろ姿は闇に沈んでいった.　Her receding figure disappeared into the darkness.
・月は西の山に沈みかけていた.　The moon was about to sink behind the mountains in the west.
・夕日が海に沈んだ.　The evening sun sank into the sea.
・満ち潮になるとその島は海面から数センチ沈む.　At high tide the island is covered by several centimeters of water.
4 〔気分が落ち込む〕 mope; be downcast; feel ┏depressed [low]; be in low spirits; be blue; 〔地味になる〕 become subdued.
►思い[悲しみ]に沈む　be buried in ┏thought [grief]
・絶望の淵に沈む　sink in a slough of despondence; succumb to despair
・沈んだ声で　in a ┏grieving [dejected, gloomy] voice
・沈んだ様子で　looking ┏downcast [glum]; with a ┏downcast [glum, despondent] air
・沈んだ色彩　a dark ┏color [hue]
・沈んだ音調　a ┏melancholic [melancholy] tune
・愁いに沈んだ表情　an expression (on one's face) of deep ┏depression [despondence, melancholy]
・沈みがちの日々　melancholic days
・最近彼女は沈みがちだ.　Lately she's tended to be ┏in the dumps [feeling blue].
・気分が沈んでいる　be in the dumps; be in low spirits; be depressed.
►沈んだ顔をしてるけど何かあったのか.　What's the matter with you? You look ┏so blue [down in the mouth].
・夫を失って彼女は悲しみに沈んでいた.　Her heart was heavy with sorrow because of the loss of her husband.
・沈む瀬あれば浮かぶ瀬もある.　There are ┏ups and downs [highs and lows] in human life.
・その髪型では顔が沈んで見えるよ.　With that hairstyle your face looks more subdued.
5 〔下位に転落する〕 fall [drop] in the standings.
►昨年の優勝校が今年はエースの不調で 10 位に沈んだ.　Last year's champion fell to tenth place due to their ace pitcher's poor condition.
・あのチームはここ数年リーグの最下位に沈みっぱなしだ.　These past few years that team has remained at the bottom of the league standings.

しょうち２【承知】 [ローマ字](shōchi)
1 〔知っていること〕 knowledge; awareness 《of a fact》.
►承知している　know; be ┏aware [conscious] of…; be informed of…; understand
・客の好みを承知している　understand customers' preferences
・百も承知している　be well aware of…; know sth full well
・当局はその危険を百も承知している.　The authorities are fully aware of the danger of it.
・ご住所は私どもの方で承知しておりますので, すぐにお届けいたします.　We have your address on file, and can deliver the goods immediately.
►無理を承知で頼む　ask for what one knows to be impossible
・できないのを承知でやってみろなんて意地悪な人だ.　He's mean, telling me to do it when he knew it couldn't be done.
►ご承知のとおり　as you know; as you are aware
・承知の上で　deliberately; intentionally; on purpose; with full awareness (of what one is doing); taking sth into (full) account
・相手が未成年であることを承知の上で酒を飲ませるのは違法だ.　It is an offense knowingly to let a minor drink alcohol.
・以上のリスクをご承知の上, ご利用ください.　Please be aware of these risks when using this ┏product [service].
►君もくどいね. そんなことは百も承知だよ.　Don't keep on telling me. I'm fully aware of it.
・委細承知. あとは面談の上.　Understood. More when we meet.
・返品はできませんのであらかじめご承知おきください.　Please be ┏aware [informed, reminded] that goods cannot be returned.
・百も承知二百も合点.　I know perfectly well what I am about.
2 〔承諾〕 consent; assent; agreement compliance; an OK 《pl. OKs》; 〔承認〕 acceptance; acknowledgment; 〔容認〕 approval.
〜する 〔承諾する〕 consent to…; agree to…; accede to…; assent to…; comply with 《sb's request》; OK 《a plan》; 〔承認する〕 accept; acknowledge; approve.
►快く承知する　give ready consent 《to…》
・両親の家で同居することを妻は快く承知してくれた.　My wife readily agreed to moving in with my parents.
・渋々承知する　agree reluctantly
・「例の資料, 明日までに頼むよ」「承知しました」　"I'd like those materials by tomorrow."―"Understood. ｜ All right. ｜ Very well."
・彼はなかなか承知しないだろう.　He's hardly likely to approve.
・母は医者嫌いで, 病院へ行こうと言ってもなかなか承知しない.　My mother doesn't like doctors, so no matter how often I suggest going to the hospital, she won't go.
・妻が外で働くのを承知しない男性はまだまだ多い.　There are still a lot of men who object to their wives having a job.
・なんでも思いどおりにやらないと承知しない.　He ┏insists on having [will have] everything his own way.
・こんな不利な条件は承知できない.　I cannot accept such ┏unfavorable [disadvantageous] conditions.
・(説き伏せて)承知させる　persuade [bring] 《sb to do》; prevail upon 《sb to do》; talk [reason] sb into compliance
・おどかして承知させる　intimidate sb into compliance.
►あなたさえご承知なら　if you ┏agree [do not mind]; with your approval
・君がそれで承知なら私はかまわない.　If you agree with that, then I don't mind.
►承知のできない　unacceptable; 〔不満足な〕 unsatisfactory
・互いに承知の上で　by mutual ┏consent [agreement].
3 〔容赦〕
〜する 〔通例否定の形で〕 forgive; pardon; excuse.
►言うとおりにしないと承知しないぞ.　If you don't do as I say, you'll be sorry for it. ｜ I'll have your neck if you don't obey me.
・今度やったら承知しないからな.　If you do it again, I'll lose my temper, OK? ｜ Next time, I won't let you off.
・そっちがよくてもおれは承知しない.　I'm set against it, whatever you may say.
►承知のできない　unforgivable; unpardonable; inexcusable.

しょち【処置】 [ローマ字](shochi)
1 〔処分〕 disposal; disposition; management; 〔仕打ち〕 a proceeding; a measure; a step.

►当を得た[適切な]処置　an ┏appropriate [adequate] measure; a proper step
・断固たる処置　a decisive ┏measure [step]; strong action
・穏当な処置　a ┏moderate [mild] measure [step]
・寛大な処置　a lenient ┏measure [step].
►処置よろしきを得る　take a proper step; deal with 《a matter》 properly.
►…の処置に困る　do not know what to do with 《an affair》; be at a loss how to deal with 《a matter》.
►処置を誤る　take a wrong step; deal with sth the wrong way; make an error in dealing with 《an affair》
・…に対して強硬な処置を取る　take strong action 《for…》
・必要な処置を取る　take a necessary ┏measure [step]
・適宜な処置を取る　deal with 《a matter》 as one thinks fit; use one's discretion in dealing with 《a matter》
・迅速な処置を講じる　take quick steps 《to do》
・最善の処置を施す　take the best steps 《to do》.
►処置なしだ.　No hope! ｜ Nothing doing!
2 〔手当て〕 treatment.
〜する treat 《tooth decay》; give medical treatment 《to ┏sb [a wound]》.
►処置済みの[未処置の]虫歯　treated [untreated] tooth decay.

・彼の承諾がなければこの書類を見せるわけにはいかない.　I cannot show you these papers without his consent.
